events.title: North Dakota and South Dakota Become States
events.description: North Dakota and South Dakota were both admitted as the 39th and 40th states of the United States on the same day.
events.significance: This expanded the United States and marked a significant development in the country's territorial organization.

events.title: Thor Heyerdahl's Kon-Tiki Expedition Ends
events.description: Thor Heyerdahl and his crew completed their 101-day journey across the Pacific Ocean on the raft Kon-Tiki, landing in Raroia in the Tuamotu Islands.
events.significance: The expedition provided evidence supporting Heyerdahl's theories about Polynesian migration and inspired future exploratory voyages.

events.title: BRAC Reports Its Recommendations to the U.S. Congress
events.description: The U.S. Base Realignment and Closure (BRAC) commission delivered recommendations for closing and realigning military bases to Congress, aiming to reduce excess infrastructure.
events.significance: The report led to significant changes in U.S. military infrastructure, optimizing resources and reducing costs.

events.title: Donald Trump Elected 45th President of the United States
events.description: Donald Trump won the U.S. presidential election, defeating Hillary Clinton in a surprising and historic political upset.
events.significance: This election had a major impact on U.S. domestic and foreign policy, and shaped the political landscape for years to come.
